titlestmt.titleproper: Finding Aid for University at Buffalo Music Department Oral History Recordings, 1980-1996
University at Buffalo Music Department Oral History Recordings
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by John Bewley.

publicationstmt.publisher: State University of New York at Buffalo. Music Library
publicationstmt.p: © 2018. State University of New York at Buffalo. All rights reserved.

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid encoded in EAD by John Bewley, September 2018.

did.head: Collection Overview
did.unittitle: University at Buffalo Music Department Oral History Recordings, 1980-1996

origination.label: Creator
origination.corpname: State University of New York at Buffalo. Music Library

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: State University of New York at Buffalo. Music Library.

did.abstract: Oral history interviews with 24 interviewees compiled by the University at Buffalo Music Library related to local and university music history.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Specified item], University at Buffalo Music Department Oral History Recordings, 1980-1996, Music Library, The State University of New York at Buffalo.

accessrestrict.head: Terms of Access
accessrestrict.p: Materials can be examined by qualified researchers in the Music Library during hours of operation during which Music Librarians are present. In order to insure access, researchers are advised to contact the Music Library in advance of visits.

userestrict.head: Copyright
userestrict.p: Copyright for the materials in the collection does not reside with the Music Library. Therefore, patrons wishing to publish any item, or part of an item from this collection for any purpose, are responsible for securing requisite permissions.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Gift of interviewers represented in the collection.

accruals.head: Accruals and Additions
accruals.p: No further accruals are expected to this collection.

altformavail.head: Alternate Forms
altformavail.p: The collection was digitally reformatted in 2016 resulting in preservation master and service copy files that match cassette sides. The files were received on a Hard drive.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p:
The collection was compiled by the University at Buffalo Music Library from multiple oral history projects with central themes of the history of music in Buffalo, and chiefly the history of the University at Buffalo Music Department. The recordings were created for projects that included the following:
Sharon G. Almquist's research for her master's thesis, A history of the State University of New York at Buffalo Music Department to 1968 (12 tapes). The text is available online at: http://hdl.handle.net/10477/2652
Alan Green's research for her master's thesis, Allen Sapp : composer, teacher, and administrator and later publication, Allen Sapp : a bio-bibliography (32 tapes)
Music faculty member James Patrick's MUS 515 class project about the history of jazz in Buffalo (3 tapes)

There is considerable overlap in the contents. For example, Allen Sapp was Chair of the Music Department and a faculty member 1961-1975. Interviews with him as the subject of a biography also contain content about the history of the Music Department. Conversations between James Coover and Carol June Bradley about the Music Library also contain information about the Music Department.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: Oral history interviews with 24 interviewees compiled by the University at Buffalo Music Library related to local and university music history. Interviewees include former faculty members of the University at Buffalo Music Department, David Fuller, Livingston Gearhart, Robert Mols, Carlo Pinto, Oswald Rantucci, Fred Ressel, Ronald Richards, Leo Smit. Other Music faculty members specifically associated with the Center of the Creative and Performing Arts include Allen Sapp, Lukas Foss, Lejaren Hiller, and Jan Williams, as well as the coordinator managing director (1965-1978), Renée Levine-Packer.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Arranged in one series in alphabetical order by interviewee.
Arranged alphabetically by surname of interviewee.
